document.masterDocTitle: An update on the spider genus Loxosceles (Araneae: Sicariidae) in the Afrotropical region, with description of seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An update on the spider genus Loxosceles (Araneae: Sicariidae) in the Afrotropical region, with description of seven new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to the Afrotropical species of the genus
Loxosceles

paragraph.keyLead: - Embolus with thin cylindrical shaft towards apex............................................................ 3

2. Basal part of embolus with a clear ridge ( Fig. 17 )...................................................
L. spinulosa

- Basal part of embolus not clearly ridged ( Fig. 2 ).............................................
L. dejagerae
sp. nov.

5. Lengthened part of cymbium triangular ( Fig. 9 ).....................................................
L. meruensis

- Lengthened part of cymbium cylindrical ( Fig. 6 )..............................................
L. haddadi
sp. nov.

6. Embolus base narrow at connection with bulb ( Fig. 10 )...............................................
L. parramae

- Embolus base broad at connection with bulb ( Fig. 16 ).............................................
L. speluncarum
7. Palp cymbium noticeably shorter than tibia length............................................................ 8

9. Embolus base broad at connection with bulb ( Fig. 18 )..............................................
L. vonwredei

- Embolus base narrower at connection with bulb ( Fig. 7 )...........................................
L. irishi
sp. nov.

10. Palp tibia length/height ratio less than 2.0 ( Fig. 12 )..................................................
L. rufescens

11. Palp bulb width about half tibia length ( Fig. 4 )..................................................
L. foutadjalloni

12. Palp patella less than half tibia length ( Fig. 8 ).................................................
L. maraisi
sp. nov.

14. Palp femur shorter than patella + tibia length ( Fig. 15 )..................................................
L. smithi

- Embolus very thing from base to apex ( Fig. 14 ).....................................................
L. simillima

- Broad basal part of embolus short ( Fig. 5 )..................................................
L. griffinae
sp. nov.
